chapter.title: &vmil; Format
chapter.para: This section of the document describes the format of the &vmil;. The list image format takes attributes from 3 different applications and builds them into a hierarchical structure. The applications are &vmic;, &stratuslab;, and &repoman;

The format fields are based upon 3 main sources so these have been placed into 3 separate name spaces. &dubcore; (dc), &stratuslab; (sl), and &vwg; (hv). The hv name space is composed from elements found in &repoman; and &vmic;.

section.title: Structure of message
section.programlisting: hv:imagelist dc:date:created dc:date:expires hv:endorser hv:ca hv:dn_x509 hv:email dc:creator dc:identifier dc:description dc:title hv:images hv:image dc:title dc:description hv:size sl:checksum:sha512 sl:arch hv:uri dc:identifier sl:os sl:osversion sl:comments hv:hypervisor hv:version dc:source hv:version hv:uri

section.title: hv:imagelist
section.para: container for metadata

section.title: hv:imagelist/dc:date:created
section.para: date in format year-month-dayTHour:Minute:SecondTimezone
section.note: Recomended to use the Zulu time zone.

section.title: hv:imagelist/dc:date:expires
section.para: date in format year-month-day when &vmil; will no longer be trusted
section.note: Recomended to use the Zulu time zone.

section.title: hv:imagelist/hv:endorser
section.para: container for endorser metadata

section.title: hv:imagelist/hv:endorser/hv:ca
section.para: standard hash id for the CA, corresponds with the CA directory files.
section.note: Message signers CA must equal this value to be valid.

section.title: hv:imagelist/hv:endorser/hv:dn_x509
section.para: x509 DN of the endorser
section.note: Message signers DN must equal this value to be valid.

section.title: hv:imagelist/hv:endorser/hv:email
section.para: email address of the endorser

section.title: hv:imagelist/hv:endorser/dc:creator
section.para: Name of the endorser

section.title: hv:imagelist/dc:identifier
section.para: RFC 4122 UUID for &vmil; this allows updating the list, and uniqueness.
section.note: This UUID remains constant for a subscription, messages with different UUID's will be ignored.

section.title: hv:imagelist/dc:description
section.para: description of the &vmil;

listitem.programlisting: <dc:description>Owens list of images from DESY quattor.</dc:description>

section.title: hv:imagelist/dc:title
section.para: title of &vmil;

section.title: hv:images
section.para: container for images metadata

section.title: hv:image
section.para: container for image metadata

section.title: hv:imagelist/hv:images/hv:image/dc:title
section.para: Title of image

section.title: hv:imagelist/hv:images/hv:image/dc:description
section.para: Free text describing the image

section.title: hv:imagelist/hv:images/hv:image/hv:size
section.para: size of the image in bytes

section.title: hv:imagelist/hv:images/hv:image/sl:checksum:sha512
section.para: sha512 checksum of images.
section.note: Images that dont match the sha512 hash will not be accepted.

section.title: hv:imagelist/hv:images/hv:image/sl:arch
section.para: architecture of the image typically 'i386' or 'x86_64'

section.title: hv:imagelist/hv:images/hv:image/hv:uri
section.para: URI pointing to the latest version of this image.
section.note: Subscriber software will use this URI to download the image.

section.title: hv:imagelist/hv:images/hv:image/dc:identifier
section.para: RFC 4122 UUID for image this allows updating the image, and uniqueness.
section.note: This UUID remains constant for a subscription to an image, messages with different UUID's will be ignored.

section.title: hv:imagelist/hv:images/hv:image/sl:os
section.para: The operating system the image runs, examples include "Linux" "BSD" "FreeBSD"

section.title: hv:imagelist/hv:images/hv:image/sl:osversion
section.para: The operating system version the image runs, examples include "SL_6.0", maybe this tag should be further broken downs so easier to process for computers.

section.title: hv:imagelist/hv:images/hv:image/sl:comments
section.para: Stratus lab suggest comments on how the image is to be deployed.

section.title: hv:imagelist/hv:images/hv:image/hv:hypervisor
section.para: Typically set to reflect the Virtualization technology values such as &xen;, &kvm;.

section.title: hv:imagelist/hv:images/hv:image/hv:version
section.para: The version of the image, so that updates can share the same metadata (with exception of dc:identifier) in case of update. Typically a numeric value.

section.title: hv:imagelist/dc:source
section.para: The URI where the latest version of this file can be found.

section.title: hv:imagelist/hv:version
section.para: The version of the &vmil;, so that updates can share the same metadata (with exception of dc:identifier) in case of update. Typically a numeric value.

section.title: hv:imagelist/hv:uri
section.para: The uri to retrive new versions of the &vmil;, that updates can be retrived.

section.title: hv:imagelist/hv:images/hv:image/hv:core_minimum
section.para: Minimum number of virtual cores required to run the virtual machine image expressed as an integer.

section.title: hv:imagelist/hv:images/hv:image/hv:ram_minimum
section.para: Minimum number of RAM required to run the virtual machine image expressed as an integer in bytes.

section.title: Example metadata files
section.para: A typical image JSON &vmil; looks like such:
and when signed using SMIME like this:
